content: Overall, our health care revenue in the second quarter was $21.8 million, an increase of approximately 17% when compared to the same period last year. Overall, we reported total revenues of $25.7 million, which included health care revenues of $21.8 million or a 17% increase as compared to our health care revenues from the second quarter of 2021. Our total customer care outsourced services revenue were $3.9 million for the quarter, which represented an increase of nearly 25% when compared to the second quarter of last year. Claims-based, also known as claims auditing, revenues in the second quarter of 2022 were $9.3 million or an increase of over 30% compared to the $7 million in the second quarter of 2021, representing growth from both new implementations as well as continued volume increases as existing statements of work move towards steady state. As we look ahead to the second half of the year, we are pleased to reiterate our health care revenue and overall company EBITDA guidance for 2022 of $92 million to $96 million and $2 million to $4 million, respectively.
